intro: Fatoua subcordata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fatoua, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climates. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, aiding in moisture retention. Fatoua subcordata produces small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
